alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Leavenworth; Wyandotte (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:43AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wyandotte, southeastern Leavenworth, Johnson, Clinton, Clay, northwestern Ray, central Caldwell, southeastern Platte and northwestern Jackson Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 543 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Osborn to near Parkville to near De Soto to Vinland. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Overland Park, Olathe, Independence, Shawnee, Lenexa, Leawood, Raytown, Liberty, Gladstone, Grandview, Prairie Village, Gardner, Excelsior Springs, Merriam, Mission, Smithville, Kearney, Bonner Springs and De Soto. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 410 and 423. Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 0 and 51. Interstate 35 in Kansas between mile markers 202 and 235. Interstate 29 between mile markers 0 and 14. Interstate 635 between mile markers 0 and 12. Interstate 470 between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 435 between mile markers 0 and 25, and between mile markers 33 and 83. Kansas Turnpike between mile markers 221 and 226. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas...and north central, northwestern and west central Missouri.
